result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, during the course of probation to the probation Agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.
- Defendant to notify DOC's Agent of all prescriptions for herself or her daughter within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC's Agent, and notify the DOC's Agent of the pharmacy used.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distributin.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- No Contact with Steve M (DOB 06-21-1984).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Lynn Schall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Document received, filed and to remain in file.
Documents on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Court orders previous judgment of conviction entered on July 21, 2014 vacated.  

AS TO COUNT 1 of the Amended Information  - 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court ordered defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
-Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions for herself or her daughter within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Seek/Maintain Full Time employment.
- No contact with Steve M (DOB 6-21-1984).
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1: Obtaining Prescription Drug by Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section's 450.11(7)(a), 450.11(9)(a), a Misdemeanor.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Sentencing. For the reasons presented to the Court, case is adjourned for Sentencing on 4/28/2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties not present for the Sentencing Hearing. No action taken. Case remains calendared for Sentencing on 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

State requests the Sentencing hearing scheduled for 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m. be rescheduled. Defense does not object to an adjournment. The case will be rescheduled for Sentencing on 3-17-2015 at 1:30 p.m., but at this time the case will remain scheduled for Sentencing on the calendar for 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17,
Letters on behalf of Defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Attorney Daugherty for the State is ill, and not present in Court. Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 3-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Sentencing. Parties address the Court off the record with a joint request to adjourn the case for sentencing. Court grants the joint request and adjourns case for Sentencing on 1-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Sentencing. 
Defense requests case be rescheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 11-25-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 26.
As to charged offense:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant is advised that this case will be assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark Branch 17, room 313 Safety Building effective August 2, 2014.
Case is adjourned to 9-17-2014 at 8:30am Branch 17

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-21-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Patricia I Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  William Levins for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5-15-2014). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Stephanie Lynn Schall in court with attorney Eric M Vega.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-14-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
